name: laura pullover
notes:
a sweater to transition through the seasons -- a sweet mock neck and a simple raglan yoke flow into a slightly cropped body and three-quarter length sleeves. this piece is worked at a worsted-weight gauge, so your yarn possibilities are endless! mix yarns as we've done here, or pick your favorite worsted-weight yarn and have a go. stripes, marls, color-blocking -- it all works!

samples shown
pink sweater shown in size 2 (39") with 7" of ease in dimond laine elmer fingering in color pop rocks held together with dimond laine birdie in color cake pop.

gray sweater shown in size 3 (42.5") with 6.5" of ease in spincycle yarns dyed in the wool in color pinky swear held together with dimond laine birdie in color thunder.

sizes
1 (2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9)

finished measurements
35.5 (39, 42.5, 46, 50, 53.5, 58, 61.5, 64)"

yarn requirements
*please note these are yarn estimates. the amount used will depend on yarn, your personal gauge, and any modifications you make.*

dimond laine elmer fingering (80% merino, 20% cashmere; 200 yards per 50g or 400 yards per 100g) or spincycle yarns dyed in the wool (100% wool; 200 yards per 50g); 4 (5, 5, 5, 6, 7, 7, 8, 8) 50g skeins and dimond laine birdie (74% alpaca, 26% silk; 328 yards per 50g); 3 (3, 3, 3, 4, 4, 4, 5, 5) skeins.

or

approx. 756 (820, 936, 984, 1099, 1218, 1312, 1498, 1593) yards /  687 (750, 851, 900, 1000, 1107, 1200, 1362, 1448)m each in a fingering/sport weight and a fluffy light fingering weight yarn to hold together throughout. alternatively, you may also use one strand of a worsted-weight yarn. 

needles
needles listed are suggested.

gauge needle: us 7 (4.5mm) 9"/22.5cm or dpns, 16"/40cm, 24"/60cm, and 32"/80cm circular needles.

ribbing needle: size us 5/ 3.75mm 9”/22.5cm or dpns, 32”/80cm circular needles or 2 sizes smaller than gauge needle.

tools
5 markers (one unique for bor); tapestry needle.

gauge
18 sts and 23 rnds = 4" / 10cm stockinette st in the round with gauge needle, blocked.
